alert.note: Alert for Crane; Pecos; Upton; Ward (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Dust Storm Warning issued March 02 at 12:26PM CST until March 02 at 1:15PM CST by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: The National Weather Service in Midland has issued a * Dust Storm Warning for... Northwestern Pecos County in southwestern Texas... Eastern Ward County in western Texas... Crane County in western Texas... Western Upton County in western Texas... * Until 115 PM CST. * At 1226 PM CST, a wall of dust was along a line extending from 8 miles northeast of Monahans to 11 miles east of Grandfalls to 9 miles north of Fort Stockton to 33 miles southeast of Saragosa, moving east at 60 mph. HAZARD...Near zero visibility with damaging wind in excess of 60 mph. SOURCE...Doppler radar. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. * This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 between mile markers 231 and 287. Interstate 20 between mile markers 72 and 90. Locations impacted include... Fort Stockton, Monahans, Crane, McCamey, Thorntonville, Grandfalls, Wickett, Fort Stockton-Pecos County Airport, Coyanosa, Imperial Reservoir, Crane County Airport, Roy Hurd Memorial Airport, Upton County Airport, King Mountain, Girvin, Royalty, Firestone Test Track, Imperial, Cordona Lake and Monahans Sandhills State Park. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Dust storms lead to dangerous driving conditions with visibility reduced to near zero. If driving, avoid dust storms if possible. If caught in one, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake. Motorists should not drive into a dust storm. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE!
